title: Object Destructuring
description: Extracts properties from objects into distinct variables.
explanation:
Extracts properties from objects into distinct variables.

Interview focus:
- Core definition and mental model
- Trade-offs and edge cases
- Practical implementation and debugging patterns
- Real production use cases
useCase: Function parameters, importing specific exports, extracting API response data

interviewQuestions.question: What is object destructuring and why is it useful?
interviewQuestions.answer: Object destructuring extracts object properties into local variables with concise syntax, reducing repetitive property access and improving readability.

interviewQuestions.question: How do you rename a destructured property?
interviewQuestions.answer: Use alias syntax: const { name: userName } = user; this keeps source key as name and local variable as userName.

interviewQuestions.question: How do default values work in destructuring?
interviewQuestions.answer: Defaults are used only when extracted value is undefined, not when it is null, false, or 0.

interviewQuestions.question: What is a common bug with nested destructuring?
interviewQuestions.answer: Destructuring nested keys without guarding can throw if parent object is undefined. Use defaults or optional chaining before destructuring deeply.

interviewQuestions.question: How would you destructure function parameters safely?
interviewQuestions.answer: Use function signature defaults, e.g. function f({a} = {}) so call sites without argument do not crash.

interviewQuestions.question: How do you destructure nested objects?
interviewQuestions.answer: Use nested pattern syntax, e.g. const { profile: { email } } = user, and guard missing parents with defaults.

interviewQuestions.question: Can destructuring be used with arrays and objects together?
interviewQuestions.answer: Yes. You can destructure arrays by position and objects by key in the same statement.

interviewQuestions.question: What happens when you destructure a missing property?
interviewQuestions.answer: The value becomes undefined unless a default value is provided in the pattern.

interviewQuestions.question: How do you skip elements in array destructuring?
interviewQuestions.answer: Use commas as placeholders, e.g. const [first, , third] = arr.

interviewQuestions.question: Why is destructuring useful in API response handling?
interviewQuestions.answer: It extracts needed fields directly and keeps transformation code concise and readable.

exercises.question: Write swap([a,b]) returning [b,a] using destructuring assignment.
Build function getConfig({host="localhost", port=3000}={}) returning normalized config.
Fix crash: function f({x}) { return x; } called as f().
Fix invalid syntax: const {a:b:c} = obj;
exercises.answer: Use const { a: b } = obj; then use b.

exercises.question: Refactor repeated user.name and user.email reads into concise syntax.
exercises.answer: Use const { name, email } = user once.

exercises.question: Given API payload {data:{items,meta}}, extract items and page in one line with defaults.
How will you destructure optional function param to avoid runtime error?
exercises.answer: Provide default empty object in parameter signature.

exercises.question: Does default value apply when source value is null?
exercises.answer: No. Defaults only apply for undefined.

programExercises.question: Program 1: Swap two numbers without temp variable using array destructuring.
Program 2: Extract name and city from user object with defaults.
Program 3: Destructure nested API response to read first product title safely.
Program 4: Build function that returns {id, email} from input object parameter using destructuring.
Program 5: Convert array [first, second, third] into object using destructuring.
Program 6: Skip middle values and print first and last using destructuring.
Program 7: Destructure object key and rename variable (name -> fullName).
Program 8: Write function with safe default parameter destructuring.
Program 9: Destructure top 2 elements and store rest in a new array.
Program 10: Extract date parts from "YYYY-MM-DD" string using destructuring.
